alert.note: Alert for Gila (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 19 at 7:13PM MST until July 19 at 8:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR NORTH CENTRAL GILA COUNTY... At 708 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain has ended in the Ellison Creek drainage just south of the Mogollon Rim. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain fell earlier this evening. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mead Ranch, Tonto Village, Kohls Ranch, Ponderosa Campground and Upper Tonto Creek Campground. This includes the following swimming holes... Ellison Creek Cascades and Tonto Creek Waterfalls. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Pyeatt Draw, Ellison Creek, Dry Dude Creek, Tonto Creek, Bonita Creek, Green Valley Creek, Moore Creek, Brody Creek, Lewis Creek and East Verde River. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall. Stay out of swimming holes along Ellison Creek.
